intro: Palicourea ulei, commonly known as blue cohosh, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Its berries are typically dark blue or black when mature and contain several seeds. Palicourea ulei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
